intro: Cladocolea andrieuxii, commonly known as the Andrieux's cliffbriar, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often with a red or purple calyx. It thrives in rocky, coastal environments and is adapted to withstand saline and arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
